sentences.sContent: Try not to lose heart (= become sad and hopeless ) - there are plenty of other jobs.
sentences.sCn: 不要灰心―还有很多其他的工作。

sentences.sContent: By the time the ambulance arrived, Douglas had lost consciousness .
sentences.sCn: 救护车赶到时，道格拉斯已经失去知觉。

sentences.sContent: I followed her on foot, but lost her in the crowd.
sentences.sCn: 我走在她后面，可是在人群中跟丢了。

sentences.sContent: Klinger lost his seat in the election.
sentences.sCn: 克林格在选举中失去了他的席位。

sentences.sContent: ...We will lose a vital part of what has made humanity as a whole so successful as a species...
...why is this a problem because without curiosity we will lose the spirit of innovation and entrepreneurship...
...He will simply lose part of his pay...
...it seems the things that cause us to lose the most sleep...
...But steamships didn't lose their sails until the 1880s...
...You may quickly lose your way in blowing and drifting snow...
...but it also causes you to lose body heat...
...Those who lose their jobs shortly before retirement age live a shorter-than-average life...
...you lose control over your life and give others the power to impose punishment that you have no control over...

synos.tran: 浪费；使沉溺于；使迷路；遗失；错过

phrases.pCn: 耽误时间；走得慢；失去时机
退却，后退；股市下跌；处于不利的地位
因…而吃亏；因…而遭受损失
失去兴趣；对…失去兴趣；对…缺乏兴趣

trans.tranOther: to stop having a particular attitude, quality, ability etc, or to gradually have less of it
